page.title: 14RAYDON CRICKET CLUB
page.content: During the 1930's the Raydon and Holton St.Mary cricket club played their home games at Holton Hall.The club then moved to the King George 5th playing field at Raydon with only a few years break during the war.Games continued to be played there until 1968 when support was low and the club closed.In 1980 the club was reformed and continued to play at Raydon with approx. 35 games each season.The team travel as far as Mendlesham but also play local teams such as East Bergholt,Capel St.Mary and Ardleigh. The club has two trophies,one for the all round player who does most for the club on and off the field and another for the player who improves his game most during the season. Each year a game is played between the present team and those who played up to 1968 called the veterans.
